intro: Diplycosia triangulanthera, commonly known as the triangular-leafed diplycosia, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its opposite, triangular leaves that are often hairy on the underside. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on short pedicels. The fruit is a small, dry capsule that splits open to release its seeds.
